Key Match Events: Curtis Campher ran a leg bye off the penultimate ball for Ireland to stun Pakistan by five wickets
Ireland scored 183-5 in reply to Pakistan's 182-6
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling, Ireland's captain, was happy to chase 180
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland set up its first T20 win over Pakistan by bowling well and fielding brilliantly
Fast bowler Craig Young conceded only 27 runs and dug out Babar Azam and Azam Khan in the same over as Pakistan got crucially bogged down in the middle overs
Others: Andy Balbirnie anchored the Irish with 77 off 55 balls including 10 boundaries
Balbirnie and Harry Tector, 36 runs, took Ireland past 100
When Balbirnie was bowled by a Shaheen Shah Afridi full toss in the 19th over, Ireland needed 16 more runs from eight balls
The second of their three T20s is on Sunday
